Talk_51:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What? <sp:5:0:0>Where are we going?<sp:5:0:0> Link, this is
the wrong way!
Talk_34:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:QuestionNormal_01>If you want to get down, use a paraglider
to float to the ground.

No need to worry about me. I can manage
a simple landing.
Talk_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseL_00>Goodness! <sp:5:1:0>You say you had a vision?
Saw mysterious figures?
Talk_52:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble>Hmm... I panicked and got off, and now
the balloon is broken again.
Talk_35:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Are you going to take me to a spot above
the geoglyph this time?
Talk_53:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Mm-hmm. It is so large, I cannot clearly
see the design from down here.

I would be better able to make it out from
a high vantage point.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>That was why I went up in the <clr:0000>balloon<clr:ffff>
Purah gave me. Alas...
Talk_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This is one of the giant pictures that
have appeared on the surface of Hyrule.<sp:5:0:0>
I am traveling the land to see them all.
Talk_36: <sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_01>I thank you, Link! Now, let's hop aboard.
Talk_70:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Anyway, I heard you had gone missing.
I am relieved to see you made it back—<sp:5:0:0>
even if your clothes evidently did not.
And Princess Zelda! Where is she?
Talk_71:
Yes, <sp:5:0:0>I still recognize you, even with that
outfit on.
Talk_37:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>If you would like to examine the geoglyph
from ground level, you can float down
with a paraglider.
No need to worry about me. I can manage
a simple landing.
Talk_55:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:TalkPositive>Phew! Good thing we got the balloon
down after your little stunt.

But it hit the ground too hard, and now it
is damaged.<sp:5:0:0> Again.
Talk_38:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Is there some place you want to be? <sp:5:0:0>
If so, you can hop off from the balloon
and use a paraglider to go toward it.
No need to worry about leaving me
behind. I can manage a simple landing.
Talk_39:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>On second thought...<sp:5:0:0>I don't see any way
to get on.

Link...<sp:5:1:0> Would you clear some space on the
balloon so I can board?
Talk_56:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you would like to see the geoglyph
again, you can use the balloon once more.

No need to bring me along. Your steering
makes me feel a bit faint.
Talk_73:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>...<sp:5:1:0>First. A word of advice.


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>According to the literature, there is
something to do with the geoglyphs
in the <clr:0000>Forgotten Temple<clr:ffff>.
<snd:Think_01>I suggest you go there and learn what
you can. The temple lies at the bottom
of a <clr:0000>canyon in Hebra<clr:ffff>.
Talk_74:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, yes... The literature says there is
something to do with the geoglyphs
in the <clr:0000>Forgotten Temple<clr:ffff>.
The temple lies at the bottom of a <clr:0000>canyon
in Hebra<clr:ffff>. Cado and I may go there
ourselves as well.
Talk_58:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_01>That was close... Somehow I managed not
to get hurt.
Talk_59:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What a <clr:0000>Dragon's Tear<clr:ffff> is, I can only guess.
But it seems such a thing can be found on
the geoglyph.
Would you try looking around? This could
be the clue we need to discover Princess
Zelda's whereabouts.
Talk_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Greeting_01>What a surprise it is to see you here
after all this time, Link.
Talk_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I heard you had gone missing. It is
certainly a relief to see you back, and
in one piece—more or less.
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_00>And Princess Zelda! <sp:5:1:0>Where is she?
Talk_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:SurpriseL_00>What? <sp:5:0:0>She still has yet to return?<sp:5:1:0>
In that case, we must use all available
means to search for her.
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Link,<sp:5:0:0> when Princess Zelda went missing,
something else happened all over Hyrule.<sp:5:1:0>

During the Upheaval, huge pictures
appeared out of nowhere, images that
sprawled across fields and hills.
<snd:Think_01>We are calling them <clr:0000>geoglyphs<clr:ffff>.
I understand they have been found in
locations across the kingdom.
Cado and I are traveling from region to
region in hopes of seeing them all.
Talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I noticed this geoglyph from a distance
while I was standing on high ground.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Examining it up close, I could not make
out what it depicted.

I thought I might have a better view from
up in the sky.

<sp:3:0:2:0000>I took to the air in the <clr:0000>balloon <clr:ffff>Purah
gave me, but then, alas...
Talk_20:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:QuestionNormal>Hm? This is no time to fool around. Put
my balloon back where you found it.
Talk_21:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Oh! You fixed my balloon?
Thank you, Link!

Will you come with me to look at the
geoglyph, then?
Talk_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>But finally we can see it. The geoglyph!
Well done, Link.

<sp:3:0:2:0000>You know, I read something in the
village's old literature—<sp:5:0:0>a passage about
what the ancients called <clr:0000>Dragon's Tears<clr:ffff>.
"Where the Tears rest upon the earth,<sp:5:0:0>
we marked down the images <sp:5:0:0>to which
they gave birth."
Talk_23:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Please, try to take the balloon <clr:0000>directly
above <clr:ffff>the geoglyph.
Talk_06:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>I believe this geoglyph is one such
"image." But even from this vantage,
its meaning is no clearer to me.
Nor can I figure out what "<clr:0000>Dragon's
Tears<clr:ffff>" might be.

<sp:3:0:2:0000>But you know...<sp:5:0:0>if the literature is correct,
one of them should be quite close—<sp:5:0:0>near
the geoglyph, or even within its borders.
<snd:TalkPositive>Would you look around? This could be the
clue we need to discover Princess Zelda's
whereabouts.
Talk_07:
<snd:Think>That geoglyph... <sp:5:1:0>Surely I could see it more
clearly from up in the sky.
Talk_24: <sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think>Oh! So you want to go back?
Talk_41:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hmm.<sp:5:0:0> Starting over...<sp:0:4:0>All I need is a clear view of the geoglyph.
Try to move us straight upward, without
going in other directions.
Talk_42:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Light a fire there and the balloon will start
to float. Then we can be on our way.
Talk_25: <sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>I know I can count on you.
Talk_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseL_00>Goodness! <sp:5:1:0>You say you had a vision?
Saw mysterious figures?
Talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Trouble_01>The wind struck and tore the
balloon apart.

I wonder if there is some way to reattach
it to its base.
Talk_43:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal>What are you doing? Please, try not to
damage my balloon.
Talk_60:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Hmm. <sp:5:0:0>On second thought, I am not sure
we should ride it yet.

For this to work, we will need the balloon
to float <clr:0000>directly upward<clr:ffff>. Will you please
make sure it can do that?
Talk_26:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseL>Oh! What happened?


Has something gone wrong? Maybe we 
should head back to solid ground...
Talk_27: <sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>What is going on?! I feel faint...
Talk_61:
<sp:3:0:2:0500>And then Princess Zelda?! <sp:5:1:0>Hmm...


The geoglyphs, the literature, the
Dragon's Tears...and now, a vision of
the lost princess.
Talk_28:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well, that was dangerous. Shall we try it
again from the start?
Talk_46:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Trouble>Phew... That was quite the crash landing.
Thank goodness you are all right.

Sadly, the balloon did not fare so well.
Talk_63:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Let us continue to examine the geoglyphs.
They may contain further clues that lead
to Princess Zelda.
You know, according to the literature,
there is something to do with geoglyphs
in the <clr:0000>Forgotten Temple<clr:ffff>.
The <clr:0000>Forgotten Temple <clr:ffff>lies at the bottom
of a canyon in <clr:0000>Hebra<clr:ffff>. I think we should
make our way there soon.
Talk_64:
<sp:3:0:2:0500>And then Princess Zelda?! <sp:5:1:0>Hmm...


<snd:Think_01>The geoglyphs, the literature, the
Dragon's Tears... And now, a vision
of the lost princess.
Talk_48:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive>Time to head out, then.<sp:0:4:0>Ah...I nearly forgot. Would you mind
doing one final thing for me?
Talk_49: <sp:3:0:2:0700>All right. Let me know when you're ready.
Talk_66:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_01>Let us continue to examine the geoglyphs.
They may contain further clues that lead
to Princess Zelda.
I am also curious about whatever it
was the Light Dragon dropped. <sp:5:1:0>Worth
investigating, I think.
Talk_67:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseL_00>I see... So the Dragon's Tears were shed
by Princess Zelda when she transformed.<sp:5:1:0>

And the geoglyphs were drawn by an
ancient people who touched those
memories and saw visions, as you did.
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Perhaps in the past they were more
attuned to that sort of thing than the
people of today.<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_01>Hm... I understand now.<sp:5:1:0> So that is the
truth of it all.

Link. <sp:5:1:0>If all of the memories you saw are
true, then that means...

Since our Princess Zelda has become the
Light Dragon, she can never again return
to her original form.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>It is...painfully tragic.<sp:5:1:0> Our dear
Princess Zelda...

<sp:3:0:2:0901><snd:Angry_00>No. It cannot be!<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Link... Would you excuse me? I need to
be alone for a while.
near_01: What is it meant to depict?
Talk_68:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I heard you had gone missing. I am
relieved to see you made it back—even
if your clothes evidently did not.
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_00>And Princess Zelda! <sp:5:1:0>Where is she?
Talk_69:
Yes, <sp:5:0:0>you tried to frighten me with that
uniform, but I still recognize you.
Talk_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think>Hmm. The geoglyph is difficult to make
out from here.

Maybe if I could look down on it from
a higher position...
Talk_30:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Trouble_01>The wind struck and completely sheared
the balloon off the base.
Talk_31:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I have racked my brain for ways to
reattach the two parts, to no avail.
Talk_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hmm. I will try and work out a solution.
Please let me know if any ideas come to
you as well.
Talk_15:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The Light Dragon... <sp:5:0:0>But what was it
doing here?
Talk_33:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>If you would like to examine the geoglyph
from ground level, you can float down
with a paraglider.
No need to worry about me. I can manage
a simple landing.
Talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Anyway, I heard you had gone missing.
It is certainly a relief to see you back and
in one piece—<sp:5:0:0>more or less.
But wait. Where is Princess Zelda?
